basic_input_output_options.title: Basic Input/Output Options
basic_input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all files.

input.description: Input directory to recursively search for files to basecall.

ref.description: Reference .fasta file to align basecalled reads to.

basecalling_options.title: Basecalling options
basecalling_options.help_text: This section contains options that should be checked before basecalling.

basecaller_cfg.description: Name of the model to use for converting signal.
basecaller_cfg.help_text: Refer to the model table on the Dorado repository for selecting a simplex basecalling model: https://github.com/nanoporetech/dorado#available-basecalling-models

remora_cfg.description: Name of the model to use for calling modified bases.
remora_cfg.help_text: Refer to the model table on the Dorado repository for selecting a modified basecalling model: https://github.com/nanoporetech/dorado#available-basecalling-models

dorado_ext.description: File extension for Dorado input. Set this to fast5 if you have not converted your fast5 to pod5.
dorado_ext.help_text: It is recommended to convert existing fast5 files to pod5 for use with Dorado. See instructions here: https://github.com/nanoporetech/pod5-file-format/blob/master/python/README.md#pod5-convert-from-fast5.

basecaller_basemod_threads.description: Number of threads to use for base modification calling, you must set this to > 0 when using a modbase aware model [0]

advanced_basecalling_options.title: Advanced basecalling options
advanced_basecalling_options.help_text: These basecalling options do not typically need to be changed.

qscore_filter.description: Mean qscore by which to filter reads. Inclusive such that reads with score >= qscore_filter are kept.
qscore_filter.help_text: The mean qscore of reads is calculated by dorado and rounded to an integer by dorado and stored as a tag in dorado's SAM output. The pipeline separates reads into pass and fail categories based on this SAM tag.

basecaller_chunk_size.description: Number of input files to basecall in each basecalling process.

cuda_device.description: GPU device to use for basecalling [cuda:all]

ubam_map_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for aligning reads from uBAM (limited by config executor cpus)

ubam_sort_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for sorting and indexing aligned reads from uBAM (limited by config executor cpus)

ubam_bam2fq_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for uncompressing uBAM and generating FASTQ for alignment (limited by config executor cpus)

basecaller_model_path.description: Override the inferred model with a custom basecalling model
basecaller_model_path.help_text: For typical use, users should set --basecaller_cfg which will use a named model from inside the container. Experimental or custom basecallers will not be available in the container and can be loaded from the host with --basecaller_model_path.

remora_model_path.description: Override the inferred model with a custom remora model
remora_model_path.help_text: For typical use, users should set --remora_cfg which will use a named model from inside the container. Experimental or custom models will not be available in the container and can be loaded from the host with --remora_model_path.

meta_data.title: Metadata options
meta_data.description: Options for sample and report naming and other metadata.

sample_name.description: Sample name to prefix file names of workflow outputs.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

docs.intro:
## Introduction

This workflow introduces users to [`Dorado`](https://github.com/nanoporetech/dorado),
our alpha-release basecaller. `dorado` is still under active development and
has been released for evaluation purposes. This workflow will be kept updated
as new releases are made. We strongly encourage users to check the CHANGELOG for
breaking changes.
